title: Group Account Director
content:
Job Overview



Group Account Director (GAD) is a leader amongst key stakeholders, including clients, internal account, creative, cross capabilities. S/he is a key driver of the business stability as well as growth.
The role is critical to the success of the business. The person must be capable of helping to deliver the VML & Ogilvy Japan GK(VOJ) strategy, specifically developing best practices typically for a range of clients under the direct responsibility of this person. 
GAD is responsible for the overall delivery of assigned clients. S/he manages a team of account professionals who are tasked with the day-to-day client service for these clients. GAD is responsible for assuring the delivery of outstanding strategic advice and excellent creative output.  
This is a pivotal position within the business, combining an ability to manage the challenges of growing a portfolio of accounts whilst juggling the responsibilities of business development and client servicing roles. The application of creative thinking is an essential part of the role. 






Key Accountabilities
Client Management 

With the line manager, responsible for achieving total revenues and direct contribution to accounts you manage 
Work with the relevant parties to deliver financial targets and control costs 
With the line manager, support the development of the yearly business plan and monthly dialogue reports for all key accounts 
Independently and in partnership with the appropriate VOJ partners, develop, refine and implement business development strategy 
Manage and ensure quality of our services  
Manage key client briefs, projects and requests, including the refinement of the above 
Typical day-to-day management of clients and their requests including presentations, documentation, client activity administration, etc. 
Present and pitch our services to potential clients in a competitive context 
Support line manager in developing initiatives and new business opportunities 
Maintain high-level contacts within business and industry relations 
Handle sensitive topics and provide issue management consulting 

 Strategy 

Provide account planning and strategic support to key clients, using excellent planning capabilities, including basic brand planning, digital engagement planning, and communication planning 
Advise clients in the development of successful customer management strategies 
Understand industry/market trends and the success factors critical to the organization’s long-term sustainability and competitiveness 
Understand the offering of the 6 Capabilities 
Modify business plans based on changing business conditions  

Creative Leadership 

Passionate about good ideas, nurtures the ideas of others 
Demonstrate enthusiasm for the creative industry in general and bring curiosity and creativity to daily work 
Inspire to help generate ideas with legs, ideas that are effective and sell for the brand 
Earn the trust and respect of creative colleagues 
Give good direction and feedback; contribute ideas; push for better work 
Challenge clients to accept our best ideas and then sell them well 
Help to ensure execution of the highest quality are well represented 

Leadership & People Management 

Establish himself/herself as a role model 
Identify good talents, inspire people to want to work for/follow him/her 
Have an inspiring and approachable style of leadership, strive to make things better 
Respect and believe in others, strive to bring out their inner greatness, ensure the development and appropriate training of team members, and build an efficient team with high morale 
Make and take responsibility for, and demonstrate commitment to appropriate decisions in a timely manner, esp. when significant information is incomplete and/or ambiguous 
Have a broad perspective and be open to varied options 
Abide by the WPP Code of Business Conduct 




Qualifications

Bachelor's degree with a major in marketing, communications, advertisement, media, digital, public relations, etc., MBA preferred 
8+ years of experience in advertising or related field
Team-leading experience 
Proven excellence in leadership 
Strong verbal and presentation skills with the ability to speak knowledgably with high level executives internally and with clients 
Detail-oriented, organized and dedicated; proactive and enthusiastic with an ability to juggle multiple tasks and meet deadlines; a quick learner 
Advanced knowledge of working software (Office 365, etc.) 
Business level or above in English and Japanese are good to have skill




 Who you are

You are a strong leader to guide and inspire teams and clients
You havde a exceptional communication skill
You have flexibility to adapt to changing industry trends and client demands
You are willing to embrace new technologies and methodologies
You are a key player to make positive atmosphere to encourage your team in any difficulties

About Us
VML & Ogilvy Japan GK was established in April 2019 as a partnership between Geometry Global and The Ogilvy Group to enhance our offering to brands in Japan in support of their business ambitions and marketing objectives. We believe in the power of creativity to drive meaningful change that delivers positive business outcomes. Now more than ever the ability for an agency to flex and adapt to clients changing needs is vital in the application of communications, brand experience, commerce and technology. Our blend of global and local expertise and marketing capability is designed to meet the challenges of today while setting our clients up for success from tomorrow and beyond. VML & Ogilvy Japan GK is a WPP company (NASDAQ: WWPGY).
VML & Ogilvy Japan GK embraces and celebrates diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide creative agency that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more brilliant work we can create together.


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
